thread.title: Pro-Europe march LIVE: Updates as supporters gather in Newcastle city centre
thread.title_full: Pro-Europe march LIVE: Updates as supporters gather in Newcastle city centre

author: Lisa Hutchinson
title: Pro-Europe march LIVE: Updates as supporters gather in Newcastle city centre
text:
Katie Collings What are the speakers saying? 
Former North East Labour MEP and Minister for Europe Joyce Quin - now Baroness Quin - was in the Lords for the vote. (Photo: Sunday Mercury) 
She said: 
“I voted for the amendment. The Lords is a revising chamber and doesn’t block legislation and the reality is the government will get its legislation through. 
“What I’m therefore concerned about is very much the prosperity of our country and the prosperity of the North East. 
“Whichever way people voted it wasn’t to get a worse deal than the one we have at present.” 
Ms Quin said she wasn’t taking to protest about Brexit and overturn it. 
“The vote is a fact and the government will begin the process.” 
However she commented that what she wanted was to maintain strong links with Europe and keep in place EU legislation like on environmental issues, which has give the UK cleaner beaches and cleaner drinking water. 
She said: 
“The referendum result was quite close. A lot of people voted to keep many of our links.” 11:34 KEY EVENT Why are they marching? 
The North East for Europe group which has organised it said they wished to show solidarity with fellow EU citizens living in the North East who are concerned about their right to live and work here. 
The march follows the defeat of the government’s Brexit bill the House of Lords last week which said ministers should guarantee EU nationals’ right to stay in the UK after Brexit. 
The vote, by 358 to 256, is the first Parliamentary defeat for the government’s Brexit bill. 
However, MPs will be able to remove their changes when the bill returns to the House of Commons. 11:30 KEY EVENT What is happening? 
Pro-Europe supporters from all around the country are set to gather in Newcastle city centre for a march today. 
Large crowds are expected to meet at 12pm at the Newcastle City Pool to march to the Monument in Grey Street. 
They will then listen to speeches from a number of high profile speakers like world renowned philosopher and author Professor AC Grayling and former North East Labour MEP and Minister for Europe Joyce Quin. Share
